title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4250.7 - Business loan types and limits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4250.7 - Business loan types and limits

State Regulations
(a) There shall be two categories of business loans to eligible businesses: (1)
a microloan that shall have a principal
amount that is less than $25,000; and
(2)
a regular loan that shall have a
principal amount not less than $25,000. (b) The program funds amount used by the
community based lending organization to fund a business loan shall not be more
than 50 percent of the principal amount of such loan and shall not be greater
than $125,000. (c) No less than 10
percent of the aggregate program funds shall be allocated by the corporation
for microloans. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4250.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
